availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James W. Caperton (Richmond, KY, attorney and soldier)

body.p: Richmond, Kentucky, attorney and soldier. Madison County, Kentucky, native. Son of William Caperton and Eliza Caperton. Attorney in Richmond, Kentucky in 1850. Attorney in Richmond in 1860. Owned one enslaved person in trust for Eliza Caperton in Richmond in 1860. Served in the 72nd Regiment Kentucky Enrolled Militia as colonel until March 15, 1864.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Madison County, Richmond, p. 252A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Madison County, Richmond, p. 147-148.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Madison County, Richmond, p. 475, (p. 5 of microfilm).
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Madison County, Richmond, p. 255B.
Find A Grave, "James W Caperton (1824-1909)," Memorial #25964815, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/25964815# (accessed December 6, 2018).
